title: Expanding Mathematical Thinking Through Fraction Measurement Concept Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Fraction Operations and Comprehension of Part-Whole Concepts
context.additional_context: Foundational mathematics concept learning course for strengthening social domain job competencies

learning_goals: Learners can interpret and solve real-world measurement problems by applying the concept of unit fractions (e.g., 1/2, 1/3).
Learners can perform division and comparison tasks of continuous quantities by applying the measurement principles of proper fractions (e.g., 1/2, 2/3).
Learners can creatively analyze fraction problems in diverse social contexts (e.g., statistics, ratios) using a generalized fractional measurement system.

resources: Teacher’s Fraction Measurement Concept Guide Manual
Group Activity Materials for Collaborative Task Performance

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
